N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 518.8 - Recovery of overpayments pending a hearing

State Regulations
(a) The department may, upon notice to the
provider and not sooner than 20 days after issuance of the final audit report
or notice of agency action, commence recoupment of overpayments. (b) If a request for hearing has been timely
made and the department's office of administrative hearings is unable to
schedule the hearing so that it is commenced within 90 days of receipt of such
request or if the department is unable to proceed within 90 days of receipt of
such request, any recovery begun under this section will be stayed pending the
commencement of the hearing. If a hearing has been scheduled to commence within
90 days of receipt of a hearing request, any delays or adjournments of the
commencement of the hearing occasioned by or attributable to the provider, his
or her attorney or authorized representative will not forestall the
commencement or continuation of recoupment. However, any delays or adjournments
occasioned by or attributable to the department will forestall the commencement
or continuation of recoupment. Notes
